KnowledgeBase.Title: compareLT
KnowledgeBase.ArgumentTypes: String Symbol Structure Dictionary Matrix Number Complex Lambda Directory Vector Brick Boolean Pair List Void Character Date Function FltVector ShortVector IntVector NumVector ObjVector BitVector ObjectRepository NumMatrix
KnowledgeBase.DataType: String Symbol Structure ShortVector Dictionary Vector CpxVector Directory Complex Lambda Pair List Brick Matrix Void Boolean Character Number Date Function NumMatrix FltVector IntVector NumVector ObjVector BitVector ObjectRepository
KnowledgeBase.RelatedFunctions: compare compareEQ compareNE compareGE compareGT compareLE

Function.Description: The compareLT function compares two objects of the same Data Type and determines whether the first object is lesser than the second object. A Boolean value is returned.

Brief.Overview: The compareLT is the comparison function that can be used with this Data Type. The resulting value is a Boolean value of true or false.
Brief.Overview-ObjectRepository: The compareLT is the comparison function that can be used with this Data Type. The resulting value is a Boolean value of true or false. The Object Repository files and NOT the file names are compared.
Brief.Overview-Void: The compareLT is the comparison functions that can be used with native data types and Heap objects. The resulting value is a Boolean value of true or false. The #void constant will always be less than any other value.
Brief.Usage: Use the compareLT function when you wish to compare two objects of the same Data Type and determine if the first object is lesser than the second object and you wish the result to be expressed as a Boolean value (true or false). The alternative comparison function,compare, only determines if two objects are equal, less than or greater than.

Argument.Name: string1
Argument.Note: The first String to be compared

Argument.Name: string2
Argument.Note: The second String to be compared

Syntax-String.Return: Returns true if the first String is lesser than the second String and false if the first String is greater or equal in value than the second String.

Argument.Note: The first Symbol to be compared

Argument.Note: The second Symbol to be compared

Syntax-Symbol.Return: Returns true if the first Symbol is lesser than the second Symbol and false if the first Symbol is greater or equal in value than the second Symbol.

Argument.Name: obj1
Argument.Note: First object to be compared. Must be a native data type.
Argument.AISTypes: Void Boolean Character Number Date Function Complex

Argument.Name: obj2
Argument.Note: Second object to be compared. Must be a native data type.
Argument.AISTypes: Void Boolean Character Number Date Function Complex

Syntax.Return: Returns true if the first Object is lesser than the second Object and false if the first Object is greater or equal in value than the second Object.
